meanings.definition: To provide a guarantee or assurance for something.
meanings.sent1: She anteed her friend that she would be there to help.
meanings.sent2: He always anteed his work to be of the highest quality.
meanings.sent3: The cat anteed to catch the mouse, but ended up napping instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun anteed a beautiful day ahead with its bright rays.
meanings.sent5: The teacher anteed success for those who studied diligently.

meanings.sent1: The lock anteed the safety of the valuable items inside.
meanings.sent2: She anteed the door was locked before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel anteed its acorn stash by burying them in different spots.
meanings.sent4: The helmet anteed his head was protected during the bike ride.
meanings.sent5: The fence anteed the privacy of the backyard from prying eyes.
